author: Generali Deutschland AG

title: Analytics Manager at Azendian Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
description:
The Analytics Manager works closely with leaders across product, sales to support and implement high-quality, data-driven decisions. He/She ensures data accuracy and consistent reporting by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures. The ideal candidate has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for our company.


Job Responsibilities



  • Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.

  • Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics support that support key business decisions.

  • Design and build technical processes to address business issues.

  • Oversee the design and delivery of reports and insights that analyse business functions and key operations and performance metrics.

  • Recruit, train, develop and supervise analyst-level employees.

  • Ensure accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting employees with comprehensive policies and processes.

  • Manage and optimize processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modelling, visualization and communication deliverables.

  • Communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to stakeholders within and outside of the company.


Job Requirements



  • Implementation experience in data quality management techniques and establish processes for monitoring, measuring, reporting compliance with acceptable levels of data quality (completeness, validity, consistency, timeliness, and accuracy)

  • Working knowledge of data mining principles: Predictive Analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on-premises and cloud-based data sources.

  • Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.

  • Experience writing advanced SAS code statements, models, and macros.

  • Experience working with and creating databases and dashboards using all relevant data to inform decisions.

  • Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes.

  • Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities.

  • Strong ability to plan and manage numerous processes, people and projects simultaneously.

  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and delegation skills.


Skills/Qualifications



  • With more than 7 years of working experience in Data Analytics or Data warehousing or similar industry

  • A keen learner with a minimum bachelor’s degree in quantitative fields such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics and related field

  • Highly skilled in Research and Data Analytics

  • A client-centric, outcome and quality focussed team player.
author: Azendian Solutions Pte. Ltd.

title: Data Scientist Manager at Azendian Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
description:
We are a fast-growing data analytics start-up that is expanding into numerous domains and industries. If you are looking to expand your capabilities in data and analytics, enjoy working for a visionary and growing company , come join us!


We are looking for a qualified Data Scientist Manager who will be working closely with the leadership team who sits across multiple functions such as product, sales to maintenance support. The ideal candidate has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and possess the business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for our company.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.

  • Build, develop and maintain the data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support the key business decisions.

  • Design and build technical processes to address business issues.

  • Oversee the design and delivery of reports and insights, analysing the business and key operations performance metrics.

  • Recruit, train, develop and supervise a team of analyst-level employees.

  • Ensure accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting employees with reference to the policies, procedures, and processes.

  • Manage and optimise processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modelling, visualisation and communication deliverables.

  • Communicate results and business impacts of insightful initiatives to stakeholders within and outside of the company.


Requirements:



  • At least 7 years of working experience in Data Analytics or Data warehousing or similar industry.

  • A keen learner with a minimum bachelor’s degree in quantitative fields such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or related field.

  • Highly skilled in Research and Data Analytics.

  • Implementation experience in data quality management techniques and establish processes for monitoring, measuring, reporting compliance with acceptable levels of data quality (completeness, validity, consistency, timeliness, and accuracy).

  • Working knowledge of data mining principles: Predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on-premises and cloud-based data sources.

  • Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.

  • Experience writing advanced SAS code statements, models, and macros.

  • Experience working with and creating databases and dashboards using all relevant data to enable the stakeholders to make informed decisions.

  • Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes.

  • Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities.

  • Strong ability to plan and manage numerous processes, people and projects simultaneously.

  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and delegation skills.

  • A client-centric, outcome driven and quality focused team player.
author: Azendian Solutions Pte. Ltd.

title: Data Analyst at Onedot (Zürich, Schweiz)
description:
Most wanted: Data enthusiast with sharp analytical skills and a flair for automated data pipelines.


Onedot was founded in 2014 to make unstructured and messy product data easily consumable by applying self-developed artificial intelligence.


We are a rapidly growing Swiss SaaS startup offering commerce and industry the first intelligent platform to source, onboard and distribute product data. Public companies with global presence and rich history as well as some of the fastest growing e-commerce startups are part of our expanding international customer base.


At Onedot, you will embed yourself into a demanding but exceptionally inspiring distributed environment with lots of room for personal growth. We are looking for colleagues who want to have a meaningful impact and shape our trendsetting product and company. High-quality work is rewarded with a steep learning curve, lots of autonomy, responsibility and swift decision-making. Become part of a multi-cultural and multi-faceted team led by the founders. Talented, curious and committed human beings from all over the globe are looking forward to your ideas and taking you on board.


As a Data Analyst, you work at the center of Onedot's platform offering. You easily grasp the customer's needs and translate requirements into reliable, performant data processing solutions. Designing, implementing, configuring and testing data pipelines on top of Apache Spark to enable customers with smart ways of automated data preparation is your thing. You like hands-on working with data and are curious to learn about groundbreaking new approaches to automated product data onboarding at Onedot. Configuring and maintaining advanced data processing pipelines and training machine learning models to map, transform and classify product data at scale is a challenge you like to embrace. Insufficient data quality catches your eye and you are familiar with running iterative approaches to further improve data quality and data processing performance.


In this position, you work closely with our data engineers who design and maintain standard data pipelines, but also with software engineering and product management. Occasionally, you also interact with experts from category-, product- or content management as well as data specialists at our customers.


Onedot designs and engineers proprietary machine learning algorithms, probabilistic/statistical methods and advanced text understanding because existing approaches do not go far enough. Our technology achieves human-like performance and has already been trained with over 100 million different products.


Onedot is a startup backed by well-known international venture capital firms and world class entrepreneurs.



Tasks




  • Design, implement and test production-grade data flows and pipelines

  • Profile product data quality of suppliers/customers, design and implement quality improvement measures

  • Train, test and improve machine learning models for automated data preparation

  • Understand, translate and implement customer requirements in data pipelines

  • Regularly adopt latest Onedot Platform capabilities to improve data processing pipelines



Requirements




  • First experience as a data analyst, data engineer or business analyst

  • Expertise working with state-of-the-art data science tools like Pandas, Jupyter and Big Data frameworks like Apache Spark

  • Good skills in scripting languages (Shell, Python or R), data formats (Excel, CSV, JSON, XML), databases (SQL)

  • Getting-things-done mentality, thriving in a fast paced environment

  • Affinity to e-commerce, product data or master data management

  • Understanding of machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) concepts

  • Advanced German language skills, oral and written



Benefits




  • Performance-oriented compensation with the option to become shareholder, because we reward high-impact work

  • Generous education & training budget to continuously broaden your skills

  • Flexible work hours, because impact, not face-time counts

  • Work from home, so that you can focus and get things done

  • Strong culture promoting open feedback and personal development, to learn from each other and push forward as one team

  • Standing desks, powerful hardware and two additional monitors for maximum productivity

  • Cool office space right in down-town Zurich, Switzerland, because we like it cosy and comfortable

  • Free snacks, drinks, coffee and other perks to keep you going

  • Regular team events to foster new ideas and better get to know each other




As part of our dedication to the diversity of our teams, Onedot is committed to equal employment opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.


This is a permanent remote or on-site full-time position with the option of using our offices in Zurich, Switzerland.


Sounds interesting? Apply today and we will get in touch with you shortly!
author: Onedot

title: Engineering Director at Tessian (London, UK)
description:
Engineering at Tessian


At Tessian, we're building the world’s first Human Layer Security platform. We’re making a difference by providing automatic, real-time protection against threats such as social engineering, human error, & data exfiltration, for people all around the world.


We’re looking for an experienced, technical Engineering Director to take responsibility for a group of Engineering teams as well as engage in long term strategic decisions as we build out our platform and drive our ability to scale. You’ll stop criminal threats and prevent embarrassing mistakes for millions of people.


You’ll stop criminal threats and prevent embarrassing mistakes for millions of people. Our high-volume, low-latency backend systems power the whole product. From deploying data science models in production, to integrating with our front end, you'll be involved in projects that span all aspects of the business.


Our mission critical product and high volumes of data mean you will have many challenging problems to solve. You’ll be surrounded by incredibly smart, talented and friendly colleagues. Engineers at Tessian love to learn from each other and pull together as a team to succeed. We all have a say in what we build and how we build it and you will be empowered - and encouraged - to have an opinion. We know that we do our best work and have the most fun as a diverse team that represents our users and the world we live in.


We work hard to develop our incredible Tessians and ensure that the Engineering team is a fantastic place to work for every gender, ethnicity, age, race, sexual orientation and educational background.


We also seek diversity of experience: some of our engineers have been building distributed backend systems in Python for years, and some have learned the ins and outs of Python on the job.


Read more about Engineering at Tessian: https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/1670277/Life%20as%20a%20Tessianeer.pdf


Tessian Stack Overflow profile


Safely migrating millions of API requests


Our First Growth Framework


Why Diversity and Inclusion is important to us


As a Tessian Engineering Director you will:




    • Take responsibility for a group of teams at Tessian

    • Join our Product and Engineering leadership team and work with our Head of Engineering, CTO and Product leader on Engineering strategy

    • Lead engineering wide initiatives focusing on improving our ways of working whilst scaling the team

    • Support tech leads with architecture, infrastructure plans and design process

    • Work closely with our Talent team to hire world class engineers



We'd love to meet someone who:




    • Is experienced managing other Engineering Managers and/or Tech Leads

    • Believes that the best engineering teams are diverseIs excited to mentor, coach and grow teams, engineers and managers

    • Is a great problem solver who takes pride in their work

    • Values getting things done over getting things perfect

    • Is comfortable with the unknown and loves to experiment

    • Can construct good arguments for methodologies or practices



Why we think you'll love it here .... It’s important to us that all Tessians are part of the journey we’re on, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark to provide above market rate salaries - there’s plenty more too…. Be at your best, both inside and outside of work



  • 25 days of paid holiday (plus 8 bank holidays, and an additional day for every year you've worked at Tessian!)

  • Private health insurance provided through Vitality Health and mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program

  • Classpass - subsided access to gym time and classes all across London

  • Choice First: Do your best work, in the way that works best for you

  • Flexible working hours and working from home (if you're not already remote!)

  • Work-from-home subsidy upon joining, so you can kit out your home office

  • Enhanced pension contributions, matched up to 5%

  • We’re family friendly, with policies built to support you in all stages of life

  • High-quality tech kit provided for you to work on, plus Tessian ANC headphones

  • If you're relocating to join the team, we'll provide a contribution to help with your costs


Equality & diversity


Tessian is an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. The Human Layer we're securing is diverse, and we know we need to be diverse and inclusive to successfully create HLS that reflects this. You can read our equality and diversity statement here. As part of our commitment to equality and diversity, we're also a corporate member of the WISE Campaign for gender equality in STEM & we're a founding member of the WEDS network driving diversity & inclusion in startups. Tessian is one of the Top-3 2021 Best Places to Work for Women. #humanfirst ‍‍
author: Tessian

title: Lead Data Scientist with Cloud Expertise at Novo Nordisk A/S (Bagsværd, Denmark)
description:
Are you passionate about using data to improve patient lives? Do you enjoy writing clean code, designing and implementing pragmatic and scalable data science solutions? Do you love working in a fast-paced, multinational environment, partnering with experts across the company? Then you might be the unicorn that we are looking for at our AI and Analytics Centre of Excellence (CoE), located in Data Management & Analytics, Novo Nordisk Global IT.

About The Department

We are a newly formed team of data scientists, analysts, and machine learning engineers with the goal of partnering across the organisation to deliver impactful end to end analytics and ML (Machine Learning) solutions spanning from Research, to Commercial and Production. We want to industrialise and democratise the way we do analytics, reducing the lead time from PoC to Prod with the creation of an MLOps framework, reference architectures and modularised components that span across the whole ML lifecycle. We are cloud native and work primarily in AWS. We work agile, embrace continuous learning and a culture of feedback and honesty, and we don’t forget to have fun.

Our AI CoE is part of the larger area of Data Management and Analytics, where we get to work closely with our AWS data lake and data science platforms, having cross-functional power to quickly design and implement scalable solutions as well as take care of operations. We are currently 40 internal and external employees in three different locations in India, USA and Denmark. We are growing fast, having doubled the number of people in the area within the past year.

The Position

As our Lead Data Scientist, you will work together with data scientists, data engineers and business experts across the organisation to build ML solutions.



  • Develop and productize state-of-the-art ML algorithms, to impact and accelerate projects across Novo Nordisk’s value chain

  • Lead the development of an MLOps framework and use of best practices. Proactively identify use cases and improve ML algorithms, libraries and methods that can scale ML across the organisation

  • Cooperate across data science, data engineering and cloud infrastructure to accelerate data science solutions and mature our platforms

  • Do technology scouting and due diligence and advise management and colleagues on tech solutions and strategy


The position is primarily located next to HQ in Bagsværd (Greater Copenhagen area), with flexible working options.



Qualifications

This role is for you if you have software development capabilities and deep understanding of data science. We are looking for someone, who has:



  • 4+ years of experience within Data & Analytics

  • Background in a quantitative field, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering.

  • Deep knowledge of Python and Spark and familiarity with other programming languages

  • Hands-on experience in designing and implementing in cloud (ideally AWS and its components i.e. SageMaker, Lambda, Glue), deploying with CI/CD and working with modern build, test and deployment tools and interest in IaC (i.e. CDK, CloudFormation)

  • Solid knowledge of Machine Learning (i.e. scikit-learn) and ideally Deep Learning (i.e. Tensorflow, PyTorch)

  • Experience in working across the lifecycle of ML or data-intensive applications, all the way from deployment to operations

  • Entrepreneurial spirit who has both the technical vision and the capability to roll sleeves up and translate needs to practical technical solutions

  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate across business and technology functions


Contact

For further information, please contact the Head of AI and Analytics Centre of Excellence Tonia Sideri at TSEZ@novonordisk.com
author: Novo Nordisk A/S

title: Data Analyst at ContentFly (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
description:
ContentFly (YC W21) is building "the" AI-driven platform for producing great content, we've grown to nearly $4m ARR in a year with a small team, no sales or dedicated marketing. We just closed a $10m Series A with Tier 1 funds like Khosla Ventures & YCombinator.

You will be our first data hire, helping build the data reporting infrastructure that powers our product and go-to-market teams. From building reporting dashboards, helping rally finances, and orchestrating data pipelines to surface insights to drive major strategic decisions - you'll do it all.

You will spend your days writing SQL, managing basic pipelines/automation & working with key strategic decision makers across the org to help them answer some of the business's most important questions.

Interested in helping build the internal data knowledge graph for one of the fastest growing companies in the world? Let's chat.


Benefits


  • Above market salary + options
  • Unlimited vacation/PTO
  • Fully remote & distributed
  • Free laptop + home office budget
  • Physical + mental health budgets
  • We'll fly you around the world multiple times a year to hang out with the team in interesting places
author: ContentFly

title: Associate Technical Consultant at FiscalNote (Washington, DC)
description:
About the Position

FiscalNote seeks a full-time Associate Technical Consultant (ATC) to join the Technical Services team. The ATC will be part of a dynamic and creative team, building python-based technical solutions, working with legislative and regulatory data. The ATC will collaborate with FiscalNotes Account Management, Product and Engineering teams in order to scope, build, test, and deliver solutions that leverage FiscalNotes data. Additionally, the ATC will interface with current and future FiscalNote clients to facilitate each stage of solution delivery.

About the Research and Development Team

The Research and Development Department at FiscalNote is where the magic happens. The Department includes the Product, Research, and Technology Teams. These teams work together to develop and deliver solutions for FiscalNotes clients. The Technical Services team is part of the Technology Organization. The Technical Services team works directly with both internal and external clients to deliver new products, prototype new ideas with the goal of market expansion, and to supplement and support the FiscalNote SaaS platform.

About You

You are a self-starter who is enthusiastic about working at the intersection of technology and policy. You thrive when interacting directly with clients. As an excellent communicator and savvy technologist, you have the unique ability to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience. You are a relentless problem solver committed to finding the right solution for a client's needs.

What to Expect in this Position:

  • Work with clients to solve for pain points by creating solutions for collecting and aggregating data from various sources, including government websites.
  • Pitch and develop new projects to drive forward the companys strategic vision
  • Research and go to market with new services that facilitate insights and improve workflows for government affairs professionals.
  • Collaborate across teams using Github for code reviews and version control
  • Some of the teams you may collaborate with include Data Science, Engineering, Professional Services, and Business Development.

What Sets you Apart:

  • A passion for data-driven decision making in Government
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • A technology-forward mindset with a background in Python or other data manipulation tooling
  • Youre self-driven and creative with excellent problem solving skills
  • A strong desire to learn more about technology and our government affairs client base
  • Undergraduate degree in political science, economics, or another quantitative degree (preferred)
  • At least 1-2 years of experience with R, PostgreSQL, or analogous programming and database languages (preferred)
  • Client-facing experience (preferred)
  • Experience with Git version control (preferred)
  • Experience with AWS or other cloud-based databases (preferred)
  • Familiarity with JSON, XML, and other commonly used data structures (preferred)
  • Experience with ElasticSearch, Flask, HTML/CSS, or any front-end development frameworks (preferred)
  • Familiarity with government data stores and experience working with APIs (preferred)

Reference ID: #LI-AW1


FiscalNote is continuing to hire new talent, with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. New team members, along with our current staff, will temporarily work remotely (unless communicated otherwise).

At FiscalNote, we Lead with Values

Know your Audience Find the Truth Drive Alignment Level Up Own the Job Bias for Action Support the Family

FiscalNote is a technology-powered global software data and media company that uses powerful machine learning to provide clients with the right policy information and insights, and at the right time so that they can better navigate market risk and uncertainty and maximize new opportunities.

As the premier hub of domestic and global information for more than 5,000 clients worldwide, FiscalNotes tools, analysis, news, and award-winning journalism delivers context, clarity, and a competitive edge in a rapidly changing world.

If your background and experience align with the competencies above, we encourage you to apply so that we can review your experience and learn more about how you can add to FiscalNotes growth and success.

Company Benefits

FiscalNote offers competitive salaries, equity packages, and retirement accounts to ensure were all FN owners. We work hard, so our open vacation policy helps us ensure youre getting the R&R you need. We offer comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance options supplemented by a flexible spending account (FSA). We have a slew of other benefits which you can check out at careers.FiscalNote.com.

FiscalNote values diversity. We are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, race, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age. FiscalNote is an EEOC employer.

FiscalNote uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all new employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.DHS.gov/E-Verify.
author: FiscalNote

title: Data Science Engineer / Architect (m/f/d) at Generali Deutschland AG (Aachen, Deutschland)
description:
Your responsibilities


To strengthen our Health Systems and BI Analytics (HSB) department at the sites in Aachen or Hamburg, we are looking for you to join us full time as Data Science Engineer / Architect (m/f/d) as soon as possible in one of our agile teams, which will be responsible for the further development of our Platform for Analytics and Data Insights (PADI).



  • You will develop future-oriented data science solutions for use cases in insurance-relevant areas

  • You will work on exciting challenges at the project location Aachen/Hamburg together with colleagues from the business units and IT

  • You will design novel data architectures for the realization of modern data pipelines and analytics solutions in the context of our Big Data platform

  • You design and develop machine learning models, processes and data provision solutions for the insurance of the future

  • You analyze inventory as well as streaming data and use our frameworks to further develop data-driven solutions and AI algorithms

  • You will access our Big Data ecosystems and use tools for continuous data analytics

  • You develop container-based, scalable solutions based on existing software frameworks and access cloud-native services

  • You will support access to structured and unstructured data as well as AI-based document processing using cloud and on-premise components

  • Using your data science solutions, you will create central assets and enable them to be used and further developed in other decentralized teams

  • You are responsible for the reliable deployment of your solutions

  • You ensure release management as well as the rollout of existing components and the operation of data science solutions (DevOps)

  • You also take on the active consulting of the customer in order to be able to use appropriate technologies for the optimization of business processes

  • You cover all DevOps areas and work in agile software development using Continuous Integration to achieve their goals together with the team


Your profile



  • You have successfully completed an IT-technical education or an engineering or scientific (computer science, mathematics, physics or similar) degree

  • You have in-depth Big Data knowledge and several years of practical experience in the field of data science and working with large data sets

  • You are familiar with basic architectures of Big Data ecosystems and have experience in designing data pipelines

  • You have very good knowledge in the use of Big Data components

  • Self-service and building your own development systems and data analytics ecosystems are natural for you

  • You have good knowledge of at least one of the programming languages used at Generali (e.g. Python, Java, Scala, or similar)

  • You have in-depth knowledge of using SQL query languages and using them in the context of Hadoop (e.g. using Hive, Beeline, or similar)

  • You have experience connecting data sources from Big Data ecosystems and are proficient in streaming technologies (Spark, Kafka, or similar)

  • You have in-depth knowledge of cloud architectures and services (AWS, GCP)

  • You have very strong experience in software development in teams and have knowledge of versioning and deployment tools (e.g. Git, Subversion, Jenkins)

  • You have a proven track record of working as part of an agile development team in the data science space and developing using cloud services

  • You do not only know the technology, but also speak the language of the business and know how to work in cross-functional, agile teams

  • A methodical, structured approach and strategic thinking are natural to you

  • You are able to quickly and independently familiarize yourself with complex issues

  • Communication in German and English is no problem for you

  • You convince through your customer orientation, motivational and communication skills as well as your confident appearance

  • Teamwork in a spirit of partnership is an indispensable part of your daily work


What you can expect from us



  • Attractive compensation, above-average corporate benefits as well as a pleasant working environment

  • A company that cares about the future of its customers and employees

  • An employer that promotes diversity, continuous learning and open cooperation

  • Exciting topics and projects and working on them in agile project teams

  • Opportunities for further training and individual skill development


Are you looking for a company that cares about the future of its customers and employees? An employer that promotes diversity, continuous learning and open cooperation? Then send us your application!


HR Services will be happy to answer any further questions you may have about the general flow of the application process by calling 0221/1636-56650.


More information on our career blog!


generali.de/karriere
author: Generali Deutschland AG

title: Business & Data Analyst at The Procter & Gamble Company (Kyiv, Ukraine)
description:
As a Business Analyst at P&G, you are a business leader from day one: you need to be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to convert insights into actions that improve P&G’s business results. You’ll need to mine terabytes of data, derive actionable insights, and translate complex outputs or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to take action to win with consumers.


You will be the primary evangelist in P&G for the power of predictive analysis and develop business cases to illustrate the “step-change” in decision-making that occurs when you anticipate what will happen, not just reflect on the past. Business expertise, interpersonal, and communication skills are therefore a must to thrive in your place in a multi-functional leadership team. Your responsibilities are innovative, challenging, and business focused.


As a P&G Business Analyst professional you will be a part of an award-winning global Data & Analytics community that operates across all of P&G’s core disciplines. You will also have opportunity to partner and learn with other leading-edge data, systems and analytics companies globally. You will deliver insights across several business domains (marketing, sales, supply chain, etc.) with a combination of modelling / analytical skills, data management and business insight. You will anticipate and tackle multimillion-dollar business problems and opportunities to transform the way P&G does business. You will use data visualization, and analytic tools to create the business building insights in mountains of data.


Are you ready to inspire us with your ideas?



Job Qualifications


We are looking for:



  • Academic or professional experience in the subject area of Data Analytics..

  • Real passion for both business and technology

  • Strong analytical skills and an analytical problem solver

  • Can then tell the story that explains the discovery, excite the audience and turn recommendations into reality

  • A leader: you envision how things can get better, set the direction, enroll others to get there and energize others until your vision becomes reality.

  • course to get the job done.

  • Is creative; finds that unique viewpoint to solve problems.

  • Has the ability to contribute and influence across levels and functions




  • Ability to learn and master new tools / programming languages quickly.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills which influence others to take action.

  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects with a sense of urgency.

  • Comfort with ambiguous scenarios and possess strong problem-solving skills with a "can-do" attitude.

  • Strong leadership skills (envisioning, empowering, influencing).

  • English proficiency, Ukrainian proficiency and at least a Bachelor's degree.



Nice to have:



  • Data ecosystems: Hadoop, Data Bricks, Spark, Hive.

  • Programming: SQL, Python, R

  • Data Visualization tools: Power BI, Tableau, Spotfire or other.

  • Data transformation tools: such as Alteryx, KNIME.



What we offer:


Responsibilities as of day 1. You will have project ownership and autonomy to deliver change and results from the beginning. Dynamic and encouraging work environment. At P&G our employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance. Continuous mentoring, you will work with hardworking people and receive ongoing coaching and mentoring from your line manager and other colleagues. Corporate and functional training will enable you to succeed and develop from day one. Industry Certifications (ITIL, DevOps, MS portfolio etc), full additional benefit program like private health care, P&G Dynamic Living programs like sport cards, in-office fitness center, PG stock options, saving plans, lunch subsidy, regular salary increases and possible promotions, flexible work arrangements, mentoring programs & trainings. Big Picture understanding of P&G IT and Product Supply organization and its Services in global multi-functional teams with several locations across continents.


Who we are:


P&G was founded over 180 years ago as a simple soap and candle company. Today, we are the world’s largest consumer goods company and home to iconic, trusted brands that make life a little bit easier in small but meaningful ways. We’ve spanned three centuries thanks to three simple ideas: leadership, innovation and citizenship. The insight, innovation and passion of hardworking teams has helped us grow into a global company that is governed responsibly and ethically, that is open and transparent, and that supports good causes and protects the environment. We commit to provide you with equal opportunities in employment! We value diversity, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
author: The Procter & Gamble Company

title: Data Scientist (d/m/w) at DEVK Versicherungen (Köln, Deutschland)
description:
Sie leben und lieben BI? Sie sind fasziniert von der Geschwindigkeit, mit der sich die BI-Welt verändert und wollen die digitale Transformation aktiv mitgestalten? Sie überzeugen mit Wissen und Können und „brennen“ für Ihr Thema? Dann sind Sie der richtige Kandidat für uns!


Aufgaben:



  • Entwicklung von Auswertungen und Modellen in den Bereichen descriptive, predictive und prescriptive Analytics

  • Exploration und Analyse von Daten aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen

  • Unterstützung der Fachbereiche bei der Definition von Use Cases und dem Aufbau eigener Modelle

  • Aufbereitung, Interpretation und Kommunikation von Ergebnissen und Ableitung möglicher weiterer Analyseschritte

  • Design, Aufbau und Pflege der zentralen BI & Analytics Plattform in Zusammenarbeit mit den Kollegen des BICC

  • Mitarbeit in übergreifenden Projekten mit BI Bezug


Profil:




  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Statistik, Informatik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung und erster relevanter Berufserfahrung

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Python oder R

  • Hands-on Erfahrung mit der AWS Cloud Cloud und den BI relevanten Services

  • Erfahrung im Bereich Machine Learning/ Deep Learning und den entsprechenden Frameworks (z.B. scikit-learn, tensorflow..)

  • Interesse an der Verarbeitung und Auswertung von großen und komplexen Datenmengen

  • Kenntnisse der wesentlichen Geschäftsprozesse und Datenstrukturen in Versicherungsunternehmen sind von Vorteil

  • Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, analytisches Denkvermögen und Bereitschaft zur Arbeit in einer agilen Umgebung (SCRUM)
author: DEVK Versicherungen

title: Requirement Analyst - Energy Market Data at Alpiq (Hlavní msto Praha, Czechia)
description:
The data acquisition team in Swiss based energy company Alpiq is mainly responsible for market data download and distribution throughout the whole company. Additionally, the team is also responsible for systems related to the end of day process.



This role is responsible for:



  • Communication with business users and gathering of requirements related to data that support their daily activities

  • Translating requirements into technical solutions, making sure proposed solutions fit business needs and are delivered in agreed time

  • Documenting the solutions, creating deployment plans, organizing all subsequent activities with the in-house development team needed to achieve the targets

  • Definition and organization of testing, getting feedback from business users (acceptance testing)

  • Maintaining existing solutions (3rd level support) / daily operation / user training



Requirements:



  • Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent degree

  • Strong analytical thinking and interest to understand business needs from the users and the ability to translate them into technical specifications

  • Knowledge of Data Warehousing and SQL

  • Good communication skills for communicating various system issues and meeting the customer’s expectations

  • Effective management of time to assure commitments are met without delay

  • Self-motivated, able to work independently

  • Language skills: fluency in English is a must, Czech, German and / or French would be an advantage

  • Full time job based on standard permanent employment contract
author: Alpiq

title: (Lead) Data Scientist (m/f/d) at Talentwunder GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
ABOUT US


TALENTWUNDER – RECRUIT. SMART. PEOPLE. More than ever, it is important to understand candidates and applicants as customers. With our Talentwunder [app] and our artificial intelligence, we support companies in finding the best candidates for vacancies and filling them effectively. We not only offer a platform for cross-network active sourcing, but also support our clients in managing the entire sourcing process.


Founded in 2014, we have been part of an association of the TOP 40 HR companies in Germany since 2020. Together with you, we want to build Talentwunder into the one platform for recruiting solutions and look forward to welcome you in our office at Gendarmenmarkt in Berlin Mitte.


To support our growing team, we are looking for a (Lead) Data Scientist (m/f/d) full-time.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT



  • As a part of our agile Data Science team, you will be supporting the product team with ideation of customer oriented data-driven products and features.

  • You will design and implement data- and machine learning powered solutions, build prototypes as proof-of-concept and take them to production.

  • You are responsible for the maintenance and extension of existing solutions.

  • You will be mentoring Junior Data Scientists in the team and report directly to our CTO.


WHAT WE OFFER



  • A multifunctional team of Doer’s who support each other, never stop learning and know that they can only be successful together.

  • An attractive benefit package with flexible working hours, the possibility of home office, regular team events and company social benefits.

  • Budget for technology events and conferences.

  • A modern and attractive office in the heart of berlin (Gendarmenmarkt).

  • Responsibility from the first day, short decision making processes and the scope to implement your ideas to further develop the company.

  • Company culture which focuses on open communication and short decision making processes which you can and should actively take part in.


WHAT WE EXPECT



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or a related field.

  • 3+ years experience in implementing and shipping machine learning and statistical models in a corporate environment.

  • Solid programming skills in Python

  • In-depth knowledge in transforming business problems into machine learning solutions.

  • Experience with common machine learning- and NLP concepts and libraries (scikit-learn, pandas, gensim, spacy etc.)

  • Expertise in working with relational databases.

  • Experience with ElasticSearch and Cloud technologies (AWS, Google Cloud or similar).

  • Fluency in German and English.


Jetzt bewerben


Impressum
author: Talentwunder GmbH

title: Data Analyst at Reply (Luxembourg)
description:
We are seeking data lovers to join our data offering!


You will have the opportunity to work on data & analytics projects in a challenging Financial industry.


We are currently working on data subject related to data & reporting governance, data quality, data science/AI and visualization topics. Your knowledge around these area will be key for the success of our current and future projects.


Tasks



  • You have a particular interest on data concepts such as regulatory, governance, reporting, quality, cleansing, visualizations, Artificial Intelligence, modelling, etc.

  • You will be part of a team working on each aspect of a data lifecycle, from sourcing to exploitation.

  • You will participate in data analytics projects (involving automation, cleansing, modelling, visualizations)

  • You will be involved in building data & analytics solutions

  • You will analyze client needs and formalize requirements from data perspective

  • You will participate in the data innovation process at Reply

  • You will help our client to be more data driven considering regulatory and strategic aspects

  • You will contribute to the improvement of data quality and the way data is managed in Financial Institutions


Benefices



  • Dynamic and challenging environment to start your career in Financial Services – as well established solution provider recognised by both, financial institutions and by regulators, we offer you an opportunity to work on a wide range of complex but rewarding projects for prestigous clients within the banking industry

  • Continuous learning – we promote internal knowledge sharing, a dedicated Risk and Regulatory Academy, external courses and professional certification programs (e.g. FRM, PRM)

  • Development opportunities – we invest in the development and progression of our people to maximise their potential

  • Great place to work – we are a non-hierarchical organisation and promote openness, teamwork and knowledge sharing within the firm and the Reply Group

  • Competitive remuneration – we offer a competitive base salary alongside a benefits package including bonuses to reward performance


Qualifications



  • Analytical skills and ability to manipulate data

  • Proficient skills in databases/data science practices such as SQL, R or Python

  • Good understanding of Data Governance, Data Quality aspects

  • Good knowledge of a data integration tool (SAS, SSIS, ODI, Pentaho, Alteryx, etc.)

  • Good knowledge of a data visualizations and dashboarding tool (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)

  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills (French and English are mandatory)

  • Eager to learn, evolve and curious to acquire new skills

  • Capacity to summarize and easily explain complex data & analytics topics

  • Ability to work with multiple skilled people

  • Structured and rigorous mindset in your day to day delivery

  • BAC+5 / Engineer school
author: Reply

title: Machine Learning Manager, Modeling at Flock Safety () (allows remote)
description:
Eliminate Crime. Build Community.


Flock Safety provides the first public safety operating system that empowers private communities and law enforcement to work together to eliminate crime. We are committed to protecting human privacy and mitigating bias in policing with the development of best-in-class technology rooted in ethical design, which unites civilians and public servants in pursuit of a safer, more equitable society.


Our Safety-as-a-Service approach includes affordable devices powered by LTE and solar that can be installed anywhere. Our technology detects and captures objective details, decodes evidence in real-time and delivers investigative leads into the hands of those who matter.


While safety is a serious business, we are a supportive team that is optimizing the remote experience to create strong and fun relationships even when we are physically apart. Our flock of hard-working employees thrive in a positive and inclusive environment, where a bias towards action is rewarded. Flock Safety is headquartered in Atlanta and operates nationwide. We have raised approximately 250M in venture capital including a recent Series D round by Andreessen Horowitz. Now surpassing a 1B valuation, Flock is scaling quickly and seeking the best and brightest to help us meet our goal of eliminating crime in the United States by 25% in the next three years.


About the opportunity


As a Machine Learning Engineer you will research, develop, and support the software that allows our cameras to see like a detective and defines how non-violent crime is eliminated. The ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about taking cutting edge research and technology to solve new problems, and enjoys working with the entire lifecycle of Machine Learning software.


Some challenges you’ll tackle



  • Frame open-ended, real-world problems into well defined ML problems

  • Develop data pipelines to create appropriate datasets and model feedback

  • Leverage cutting-edge research and technology to create custom solutions

  • Design and run experiments to test new ideas or improvements to existing models

  • Develop applications to run machine learning in production

  • Build visualization and monitoring tools to evaluate the quality of our data and models

  • Collaborate across teams and product to deliver solutions that fit within business and organizational requirements

  • Review code of other Machine Learning Engineers


About You



  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or proof of equivalent software engineering experience (PhD’s welcome)

  • Experience solving problems using Machine Learning frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.)

  • Good understanding of Deep Learning and Traditional ML (supervised and unsupervised) algorithms

  • Strong experience writing Python in a team environment

  • Able to take on complex problems, learn quickly, iterate, and persist towards a good solution

  • Effectively communicate, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood

  • Basic SQL knowledge

  • Basic git knowledge

  • Experience with linear algebra, probability, and statistics preferred

  • Experience with Java, Kotlin, or C++ is nice to have


Why join the Flock?


When you join the Flock, you are joining a diverse team of passionate, ambitious, intelligent people that put the team over self. We offer competitive salary, benefits, and the opportunity to grow your career at a fast-paced, high growth start up. We genuinely care about the well-being of our employees both in and out of the office and understand the importance of work/life balance. We’d love for you to join us in the fight to eliminate non-violent crime, one neighborhood at a time.
author: Flock Safety

title: Lead Systems Architect (F/M) at Worldline (Paris, France)
description:
Lead Systems Architect, Platform-as-a-Service, Permanent, Paris/Remote (FR)


Company:


Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry and #4 player worldwide. With its global reach and its commitment to innovation, provides its clients with sustainable, trusted and secure solutions across the payment value chain and offers best-in-class payment services ranging from POS, online payments, omnichannel solutions to issuing & acquiring and digital banking to nearly one million merchants and 1,200 banks and financial institutions. With 20,000 employees and powered by the dedication of some of the brightest talents in the payments industry, Worldline is shaping new ways of paying, living and doing business.


A key part of the strategic transformation of one business line is to build-up and deliver a world-class, cloud-based Payments Platform as a Service (PPaaS) that empowers our ecosystem of clients and partners to offer their merchant customers state-of-the-art payment and commerce solutions available anytime, anywhere.


Reporting to the CTO, the Lead Systems Architect:



  • Provides Architectural leadership and vision for Payment Platforms as a service by developing and maintaining architectural roadmap for products and services plus ensuring alignment with the business and enterprise architecture strategies and standards. Able to develop, present and explain the value and vision of proposed architectures and solutions to a wide range of audience.

  • Contributes to the PaaS strategies and roadmap development to meet business objectives with existing or emerging technologies, able to translate business concepts to technical terms.

  • Applies creative thinking/approach to determine technical solutions that further business goals and align with corporate technology strategies, keeping in mind performance, reliability, scalability, usability, security, flexibility, and cost.

  • Defines and drives technology standard and best practices in the Platform-as-a-service areas, and lead some key projects.

  • Oversees and signs off key architecture artifacts in the group.

  • Articulates technology solutions as well as explains the competitive advantages of various technology alternatives.

  • Collaborates with the key stakeholders, other product development groups and software vendors to identify and define solutions for complex business and technical requirements.

  • Engages with Platform-as-a-service customers/partners to understand their needs and provide suggestions/guidance on what platform techniques are appropriate to solve their problems with pros/cons articulated clearly.

  • Drives internal proof of concept initiatives; when needed, quickly design and implement a prototype of a system or component with a proper architecture, and then hand over to (may lead) a small group of devs to finish.

  • Provide mentorship and help team growth especially on technical side.


For succeeding in this role, you are an experienced technology leader with a minimum of 15 years of software development experience including 5+ years of application or platform architecture experience with deep technology expertise in the following:



  • Familiar with information Security and SOC Operations, documentation and maintenance of all IT and security standards,

  • Architecture design and development of large scale platforms and application with simple solutions,

  • Deep knowledge and hands on experience on big data and cloud computing technologies,

  • Extensive hands on design/coding experience/skills using languages like Java, or C#/C++/C#, python, go, ERLANG, R, etc. Strong on elegant coding, can write very solid prototypes or core components quickly,

  • Strong service architecture and development experience with high performance and scalability,

  • Technical background in data with deep understanding of issues in multiple areas such as data acquisition and processing, data management, distributed processing, and high availability is required; experience in statistics, data mining, machine learning and operational excellence of production systems is a plus,

  • Strong at technical goal setting for a project with actionable success metrics; good knowledge and experience on measuring a service from user experience angle,

  • Strong on driving for results and self-motivated, strong learning mindset, with good understanding of related advanced/new technology; keep up with the technology development in the related areas in the industry, which could be leveraged to enhance current architectures and build durable new ones,

  • Outstanding verbal, written, presentation, facilitation, and interaction skills, including ability to effectively communicate architectural issues and concepts to multiple organization levels and executive management.
author: Worldline

title: Cellular Microservices Developer at MITRE (McLean, VA)
description:
MITRE’s Communications Network Engineering and Analysis Department (L111), which is part of MITRE’s Infrastructure and Networking Innovation Center, seeks an engineer who is passionate about communications networks to perform research, design, development, prototype, and test in the areas of next generation 5G platform and ecosystem. You will work with a team of engineers who specialize in providing networking expertise on a wide variety of projects to solve our nation’s most complex problems.



Key Functions:



  • Quickly prototype and test proof of concept microservices for real time and near real time use cases at 5G cellular edge in support of business verticals.

  • Develop AI/ML based control algorithms to ensure services with low latency, high availability, high performance, and high Quality of Experience characteristics.

  • Analyze and onboard 5G use cases as part of Proof of Concept demonstrations.

  • Participate in documentation, information sharing, and technical exchange.

  • Stay abreast of new technology/technical areas and cultivate innovation.



Minimum Qualifications:



  • BS and 5 years related experience

  • Applicants selected for this position will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or applicants who are eligible for security clearances.



Required Qualifications:


We are interested in highly motivated and enthusiastic candidates with a wide variety of skills to dig deep on challenging technical problems. Qualifications include:



  • Knowledge of wireless technologies and cellular systems

  • Strong foundation in full software development lifecycle activities

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, such as Python, Java, C++, or C

  • Ability to effectively communicate and present software architecture, algorithms, and security concepts as a technical advisor

  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaborate across teams/projects to achieve results

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a US Secret security clearance



Preferred Qualifications:



  • MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field

  • Technical, task, or project leadership experience

  • Willingness/passion for mentoring and developing junior engineers

  • Knowledge on 5G interfaces, protocols, and procedures

  • Knowledge on ESTI MANO and MEC specifications

  • Knowledge of the ORAN RIC (RAN Intelligent Controller) and the ability to apply microservice development knowledge to the development of RIC xApps and rApps

  • Experience with embedded systems and the implementation of wireless protocol stacks

  • Experience with AI/ML application development for data analytics in support of specific use cases, such as smart vehicles (e.g., UAS/UAV/Drones), factory automation, surveillance using IoT devices (e.g., cameras and sensors), and remote medicine (e.g., remote surgery)

  • Experience with management and automation of virtualized resources at scale using ETSI MANO compatible solutions such as ONAP

  • Hands on experience in microservice development on container platforms, such as Azure AKS, AWS EKS, Red Hat OpenShift, etc.

  • Experience developing microservices-based application on cloud-based container platforms

  • Coding experience in Go, Python, or C++

  • Experience with open-source data visualization dashboard tools such as Kibana and Grafana

  • Experience with cross-platform database programs such as MongoDB, and stream processing software such as Kafka
author: MITRE

The goal is to build and optimize our risk control algorithm system, ensuring the stable development of the business. Passionate about solving complex and challenging questions. - Possesses more than three years of effective team management experience Preferred Qualifications: - Experiences in the research and development of internet risk control anti-fraud related algorithms - Experience in the e-commerce industry, anti-spam or security strategies, or knowledgable about dealing with the black market.

title: Leiter (d/m/w) Data & Analytics at DEVK Versicherungen (Köln, Deutschland)
description:
